intro: Centunculus pentandrus var. elongatus, commonly known as the long-stemmed mouse-ear. This plant is a variant of the mouse-ear species, characterized by its elongated stems and small, kidney-shaped leaves. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae, known for its delicate appearance and early spring blooming habit. The flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
